definitions.example: The train hit the buffers with a great shock.

definitions.definition: A discontinuity arising in the solution of a partial differential equation.
To cause to be emotionally shocked, to cause (someone) to feel surprised and upset.
To give an electric shock to.
To meet with a shock; to collide in a violent encounter.
An arrangement of sheaves for drying; a stook.
A lot consisting of sixty pieces; a term applied in some Baltic ports to loose goods.
(by extension) A tuft or bunch of something, such as hair or grass.
definitions.example: His head boasted a shock of sandy hair.

definitions.definition: A small dog with long shaggy hair, especially a poodle or spitz; a shaggy lapdog.
To collect, or make up, into a shock or shocks; to stook.
